title: McDonald's is bringing back the McRib on Nov. 1
text:
The sandwich, made with boneless pork, barbecue sauce, onions and dill pickles, launched in Kansas City, Kansas in 1981 and has since gained popularity — thanks, in part, to the internet.

“The hype around its annual return even gave birth to the phrase ‘McRib Season,” according to the fast-food giant.

The return of the McRib is the latest menu announcement from McDonald's, which has lately mined its own menu and past limited-time offers to generate buzz and sales.

See:Instead of playing the celebrity game, I'd rather see McDonald's put more effort into developing new products

The company's My Famous Orders program has paired McDonald's with big names across music, including Travis Scott and BTS, who have created special meals comprised of items like the Big Mac and Chicken McNuggets.

Saweetie was the most recent celebrity to participate in the program.

Other fast-food chains, like Jack In the Box JACK with Jason Derulo and Yum Brands Inc.'s YUM Taco Bell with Lil Nas X, have followed suit with their own celebrity partnerships.

McDonald's stock is up 13.4% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index SPX has gained 16.1% for the period.
